name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

key_work.title: Little J & Big Cuz
key_work.brief_description: Little J, he’s five and Big Cuz, she’s nine. They’re a couple of Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog.

constellations_primary.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_primary.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

start.title: Tama Tū
start.creator_credit: Ainsley Gardiner, Cliff Curtis, New Zealand Film Commission, Whenua Films, Kayne Horsham and Tim Capper
start.brief_description: Maori troops fighting in Europe during World War II entertain themselves in a house while waiting for a battle to begin in this short from Taika Waititi.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

end.title: Whale Rider
end.creator_credit: Frank Hübner, John Barnett, Tim Sanders and Pandora Film
end.brief_description: Whale Rider is a 2002 New Zealand-German family drama film written and directed by Niki Caro, starring Keisha Castle-Hughes as Kahu Paikea Apirana, a 12-year-old Māori girl whose ambition is to become the chief of the tribe.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

links.description: Tama Tū took a serious subject – World War II – and added a comedic riff by following Māori troops in Europe entertaining themselves before battle. Starring as one of the soldiers was veteran actor Taungaroa Emile who appeared in Whale Rider.

start.title: Roma
start.creator_credit: Alfonso Cuarón, Gabriela Rodríguez, Nicolás Celis and Savio Adarsh
start.headline_credit: Mexico and United States of America, 2018
start.brief_description: In 1970s Mexico City, two domestic workers help a mother of four while her husband is away for an extended period of time.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

end.title: Blade II
end.creator_credit: Patrick J. Palmer, Peter Frankfurt and Wesley Snipes
end.brief_description: A rare mutation has occurred within the vampire community - The Reaper. A vampire so consumed with an insatiable bloodlust that they prey on vampires as well as humans, transforming victims who are unlucky enough to survive into Reapers themselves. Blade is asked by the Vampire Nation for his help in preventing a nightmare plague that would wipe out both humans and vampires.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

links.description: Alfonso Cuarón won Academy Awards for Best Directing and Best Cinematography with Roma. He’s a member of a group of friends known as the Three Amigos, which includes fellow Oscar-winning filmmakers Guillermo Del Toro, and Alejandro Iñárritu. Del Toro directed Blade II.

start.title: Blade II
start.creator_credit: Patrick J. Palmer, Peter Frankfurt and Wesley Snipes
start.brief_description: A rare mutation has occurred within the vampire community - The Reaper. A vampire so consumed with an insatiable bloodlust that they prey on vampires as well as humans, transforming victims who are unlucky enough to survive into Reapers themselves. Blade is asked by the Vampire Nation for his help in preventing a nightmare plague that would wipe out both humans and vampires.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

end.title: Ip Man
end.creator_credit: Lee Pik-Kwan, Raymond Wong, Beijing ShengShi HuaRei Film Investment & Management Co., China Film Co-Production Corporation, Golden Harvest Company, New Film Studio of Beijing Starlight International Media Co. Ltd., Prosperity Pictures, Shanghai Film Group, Time Antaeus Media Group, Kenneth Mak Kwok-Keung and Ralph Chun Ho Poon
end.brief_description: A semi-biographical account of Yip Man, the first martial arts master to teach the Chinese martial art of Wing Chun. The film focuses on events surrounding Ip that took place in the city of Foshan between the 1930s to 1940s during the Second Sino-Japanese War. Directed by Wilson Yip, the film stars Donnie Yen in the lead role, and features fight choreography by Sammo Hung.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

links.description: The success of Blade II was considered Del Toro’s breakthrough into Hollywood. Playing Snowman in the film and choreographing key fight scenes was Chinese star Donnie Yen, who’s best known for Ip Man.

start.title: Ip Man
start.creator_credit: Lee Pik-Kwan, Raymond Wong, Beijing ShengShi HuaRei Film Investment & Management Co., China Film Co-Production Corporation, Golden Harvest Company, New Film Studio of Beijing Starlight International Media Co. Ltd., Prosperity Pictures, Shanghai Film Group, Time Antaeus Media Group, Kenneth Mak Kwok-Keung and Ralph Chun Ho Poon
start.brief_description: A semi-biographical account of Yip Man, the first martial arts master to teach the Chinese martial art of Wing Chun. The film focuses on events surrounding Ip that took place in the city of Foshan between the 1930s to 1940s during the Second Sino-Japanese War. Directed by Wilson Yip, the film stars Donnie Yen in the lead role, and features fight choreography by Sammo Hung.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

end.title: Onimusha 3: Demon Siege
end.brief_description:
Onimusha 3 is the third game of the Onimusha series. The story focuses on the returning hero, swordsman Hidemitsu Samanosuke Akechi, who is in his quest to defeat his nemesis, Nobunaga Oda, who wishes to conquer Japan with his army of demons known as Genma. However, Samanosuke changes places with a French officer from the future named Jacques Blanc, and both have to adapt to their new worlds to get rid of Nobunaga and the Genma.

The game retains elements from previous games in the franchise including the use of multiple special weapons in order to fight enemies and absorb their energy to enhance the weaponry. This time the player primarily controls both Samanosuke and Jacques in separate scenarios. The two are able to exchange items in order to solve puzzles. The development from this game started after the release of the PlayStation 2 which allowed the team to work on a 3D engine to design 3D backgrounds. In order to appeal to the Western market, the team set this game in Paris and chose French actor Jean Reno to portray Jacques.

Onimusha 3 has been generally well received by publications for video games. Most of the writer’s praise focused on the improved controls and the use of a 3D engine that allowed better combat and visuals, respectively. The game also generated good sales with over 1.5 million copies sold as of May 2008.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

links.description: Donnie Yen became one of the most accomplished martial artists in the world. Often showcasing his skill in films like Ip Man, he also frequently works as a stunt and fight choreographer like he did for Onimusha 3: Demon Siege.

end.title: Moana
end.creator_credit: John Musker, Ron Clements, Chris Williams, Don Hall, Osnat Shurer, Hurwitz Creative, Walt Disney Animation Studios and Lisa Keane
end.brief_description: In Ancient Polynesia, when a terrible curse incurred by Maui reaches an impetuous Chieftain’s daughter’s island, she answers the Ocean’s call to seek out the demigod to set things right.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

constellations_other.name: Go Bang
constellations_other.description: Australian dance act PNAU are renowned for groundbreaking visuals in their music videos, including for their 2017 single 'Go Bang' which featured Kira Divine.

constellations_other.name: Transfiguration
constellations_other.description: Transfiguration follows the cycle of evolution through a figure who transforms through the elements, from lava and rock to diamonds and steam. Creatures born from the elements have long been part of screen culture.

links.description: Little J & Big Cuz is the first Indigenous animated children’s series, with specific episodes adapted into language. Disney’s Moana was also adapted into several different First Nation languages, including te reo: the traditional language of New Zealand’s Māori people.

start.title: Moana
start.creator_credit: John Musker, Ron Clements, Chris Williams, Don Hall, Osnat Shurer, Hurwitz Creative, Walt Disney Animation Studios and Lisa Keane
start.brief_description: In Ancient Polynesia, when a terrible curse incurred by Maui reaches an impetuous Chieftain’s daughter’s island, she answers the Ocean’s call to seek out the demigod to set things right.

end.title: Tama Tū
end.creator_credit: Ainsley Gardiner, Cliff Curtis, New Zealand Film Commission, Whenua Films, Kayne Horsham and Tim Capper
end.brief_description: Maori troops fighting in Europe during World War II entertain themselves in a house while waiting for a battle to begin in this short from Taika Waititi.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

links.description: Moana featured key Polynesian myths and legends. Taika Waititi consulted on elements of the story and also produced the te reo version, which screened for free in New Zealand. One of his first forays into filmmaking was Tama Tū.

start.title: Whale Rider
start.creator_credit: Frank Hübner, John Barnett, Tim Sanders and Pandora Film
start.brief_description: Whale Rider is a 2002 New Zealand-German family drama film written and directed by Niki Caro, starring Keisha Castle-Hughes as Kahu Paikea Apirana, a 12-year-old Māori girl whose ambition is to become the chief of the tribe.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

end.title: Roma
end.creator_credit: Alfonso Cuarón, Gabriela Rodríguez, Nicolás Celis and Savio Adarsh
end.headline_credit: Mexico and United States of America, 2018
end.brief_description: In 1970s Mexico City, two domestic workers help a mother of four while her husband is away for an extended period of time.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

links.description: Whale Rider (2003) saw its star Keisha Castle-Hughes become the first indigenous actress to be nominated for an Academy Award in the Best Actress category when she was just 12-years-old. The next time an indigenous actor was nominated was Yalitza Aparicio in Roma.
